page.title: 01WEST PENNINE MOORS
page.content: The whole of the survey area lies within the 90 square miles known as the West Pennine Moors. Dominating the {landscape}is Winter hill,456 metres in height and formed of gritstone rock. Most of the land surface is{moorland. There are two disused quarries in the area, at Hill Top and Hordern Delf. Recently the army has removed old incendiary bombs which were tested at "Old Rachel's"(a ruin) during the Second World War. The West Pennine Moors has a ranger service which provides information to visitors, deals with emergencies and protects property and animal life. The village of Belmont is the only centre of{population}in the area. The {housing}of the village includes 19th century stone cottages and newer houses dating from about 1970 onwards.
